mas.machineproxy.component

Class Component

  • java.lang.Object
    • mas.machineproxy.component.Component
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, IComponent

    public class Component
extends java.lang.Object
implements IComponent, java.io.Serializable
    Author:
    Anand Prajapati

    The weibull distribution being used here follows a constructor weibull ( shape parameter, scale parameter) weibull ( beta , eta ) The variable keep track of age is currentAge. Initial age is used to model imperfect repairs of component. LifeToFailure is used as the life of component i.e. when the component will fail i.e. 'currentAge - initialAge' becomes equal to 'lifeToFailure'

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addAge(long millis)
      Age the component by amount of millis
      double generateConditionalLife()
      Generates a life to failure for component based on accumulated time so far using conditional reliability equation
      void generateLifeRFtype1()
      generate new initial age for the component after being repaired based on restoration factor type 1 For theory of restoration factor, please refer to http://www.reliawiki.org/index.php/Imperfect_Repairs repairs will only fix the wear-out and damage incurred during the last period of operation
      void generateLifeRFtype2()
      generate new initial age for the component after being repaired based on restoration factor type 2 For theory of restoration factor, please refer to http://www.reliawiki.org/index.php/Imperfect_Repairs repairs fix all of the wear-out and damage accumulated up to the current time

    • Method Detail

      • generateConditionalLife

        public double generateConditionalLife()
        Generates a life to failure for component based on accumulated time so far using conditional reliability equation

      • generateLifeRFtype1

        public void generateLifeRFtype1()
        generate new initial age for the component after being repaired based on restoration factor type 1 For theory of restoration factor, please refer to http://www.reliawiki.org/index.php/Imperfect_Repairs repairs will only fix the wear-out and damage incurred during the last period of operation

      • generateLifeRFtype2

        public void generateLifeRFtype2()
        generate new initial age for the component after being repaired based on restoration factor type 2 For theory of restoration factor, please refer to http://www.reliawiki.org/index.php/Imperfect_Repairs repairs fix all of the wear-out and damage accumulated up to the current time
